column4: GM sets four more recalls  covering over 105 000 vehicles
column5: DETROIT General Motors Co on Friday announced four more recalls covering 105 688 cars and trucks globally  raising the number of recalls to 34 including the high-profile for defective ignition switches linked to at least 13 deaths.

column4: TIMELINE-General Motors grapples with safety crisis
column5: General Motors Co has been grappling with a crisis over its 11-year failure to recall cars equipped with faulty ignition switches. The flaw could cause engines to shut off  leading to a sudden loss of power steering and power brakes  and the failure of air bags to deploy in a crash. So far  GM has attributed at least 54 crashes and 13 deaths to switch-related air bag malfunctions. It was only in February of this year that GM finally began recalling 2.6 million Chevrolet Cobalts  Saturn Ions and

column4: GM internal probe details years of missteps on deadly switch
column5: WASHINGTON A 325-page report on General Motors Co's mishandling of a deadly ignition switch details missteps by employees and officials over 11 years - from lawyers who failed to heed warnings the company could be liable for punitive damages to a product safety team that tried to replicate driver complaints by driving in a company parking lot.

column4: Former Merck dealmaker takes aim at colon germ
column5: An infectious disease expert and former head dealmaker at Merck & Co is racing against his ex-employer and other drugmakers to develop a treatment for a germ that ravages the colon and kills as many as 14 000 Americans each year.
